alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 26 at 11:27PM EDT until June 27 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Duck Creek, and adjacent low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1112 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in two rounds Sunday. Duck Creek at Macksburg was at 12.5 feet and rising slowly as of 1030 PM EDT, after rising 4 feet between 6:30 pm and 8:30 pm Sunday. Duck Creek is likely to rise rapidly again overnight in response to the second round of rain, and exceed its 13-foot bankfull stage. It is likely to take all morning Monday to recede below its banks there. Harrietsville on the east fork of Duck Creek was at 6.6 feet and rising. It may reach or exceed its 17-foot bankfull stage before dawn Monday. Whipple on Duck Creek below the merge lags several hours behind and was just beginning to rise. It was near 2 feet, but may reach or exceed its 12-foot bankfull stage Monday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
